name: K2-37
scenarioDescription:
The K2-37 Exoplanetary System

K2-37 is a star with 0.9 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.85 times its radius. It is located 589.89 light years away from the solar system.

K2-37 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-37 b

K2-37 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.44 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-37.

The mass of K2-37 b is 3.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-37 b is 1.61 that of Earth. At 3.04 Earth masses, K2-37 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-37 c

K2-37 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.43 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-37.

The mass of K2-37 c is 10.87 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-37 c is 2.75 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-37 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

K2-37 d

K2-37 d was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 14.09 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-37.

The mass of K2-37 d is 10.76 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-37 d is 2.73 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-37 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-37, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by K2.
